medical_history.chief_complaint: Congenital hypothyroidism and goiter with bilateral moderate hearing loss.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient presented at birth with primary hypothyroidism and goiter. Hearing loss was identified at 1 month of age with thresholds of 55 dB in the right ear and 50 dB in the left ear, consistent with bilateral moderate hearing loss. At 13 months, the auditory brainstem response thresholds improved to 30 dB (right) and 40 dB (left).
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born with elevated TSH levels indicating hypothyroidism, which was treated with T4 replacement therapy.
medical_history.family_history: Parents and two sisters of the patient have no signs of hypothyroidism, goiter, or hearing loss.
